column4: Ok. after looking on the ubuntu wiki and forum, none of my usb wireless network cards are supported. I really want unternet for my ubuntu computer, but don't want to run a cable all through the house. am i screwed?
Fryguy: don't have a pci wireless card. don't know what a wap is (or a repeater for that matter)
you can buy another, cheap, guaranteed-to-work card. That way you support those who release drivers and cooperate with open source.
it is 7 at night, it is alittle late to go do anything right now.
what are these cards you have that don't work?
well I don't mean buy them right now! I mean next time you have the time.
the drivers are already compiled when you install the distribution so getting and compiling source most probably won't do anything better.
i got it. that was my attempt at sarcasm. guess i forgot to stretch my sarcasm muscle
you are hilarious. I like you. Anyway. Which cards are these? I need to know which not to buy.
the last resort would be to use "ndiswrapper" to use your windows XP drivers in linux. But since you checked the wikis and forums...
Ndiswrapper? is that like wine?
it is only good for network drivers, search the term NDIS (wikipedia).
thanks for the help.
alright. so if it isn't in the wiki or the forum it won't work, period?
most probably. But I need to know the model. Maybe I can search better than you.
d-link wua 1340
potato but yes, if it doesn't appear on the forums, congratulations your device is unique. Only you possess it in the whole planet.

before you go to far searching for me, keep in mind that i have only looked at the official ubuntu documentation. i did a quick google search too. I'll search for a while than come back if i need help or run out of ideas.
here is a link I just found. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Device/D-Link_WUA-1340
I'll try that and come back to you
oh yes. I've heard of WICD before. I've never used it.
i will try wicd. thanks for all of your help!
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=506907&highlight=dlink+1340
and anybody alse who cares: using wicd i was able to get my wireless card (wua 1340) working! yay
